title: Kmart announces the release of same-sex family doll sets
text:
Shoppers have welcomed Kmart's launch of same-sex family doll sets, but some have slammed the retail giant for only including 'white people' in the new range.

The $15 'Family Playset' is available exclusively online and comes in three different sets.

One set has male parents and two small children, while another has female parents and two kids.

Another set features a heterosexual couple, also with a children.

Each family comes with accessories such as a picnic basket, food options, a stroller, a baby doll, and a dog.

The $15 'Family Playset' is available exclusively online and comes in three different sets

'Products are sold separately and come in various designs,' their website reads.

'We cannot guarantee which design you will receive as products are selected at random for online orders.'

Hundreds of shoppers welcomed the launch, saying it has been a long time coming.

'Progress. Kmart is selling super cute same-sex family doll sets,' one person wrote.

'Kmart continues to win,' another commented, while a third said: 'I love this!'

'Amazing to see!' someone else wrote.

Other shoppers however, said children don't even 'see' gender on toys and that the new range includes 'white-people only' dolls.

'Kids don't notice what the dolls are,' wrote one.

'Kmart, it seems, are selling White People Only Same-Sex Family Doll Sets,' someone complained.

'No thanks,' another wrote.
description: The $15 'Family Playset' is available exclusively on the Kmart Australia's website and comes in three different sets.
authors: Sahar Mourad For Daily Mail Australia
